item.title: 国际货币基金组织开始访问莫桑比克并表示将继续提供支持
item.description: 代表团团长巴勃罗-洛佩斯-墨菲说，国际货币基金组织正在访问莫桑比克，并承诺将继续提供支持。【原文：The International Monetary Fund is visiting Mozambique and has pledged its continued support, Mission Chief Pablo Lopez Murphy said.】

item.title: 欧盟贸易首脑表示愿与美国合作降低关税
item.description: 欧盟贸易负责人表示，欧盟愿意与特朗普政府合作达成一项协议，降低工业产品的关税，增加对天然气和大豆等美国出口商品的采购。【原文：The European Union is willing to work with the Trump administration on a deal that would lower tariffs for industrial goods and boost purchases of American exports like natural gas and soybeans, the bloc’s trade chief said.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿加瓦尔为印度核电站寻找合作伙伴
item.description: 亿万富翁阿尼尔-阿加瓦尔（Anil Agarwal）控制的韦丹塔集团（Vedanta Group）正在寻求全球企业竞标在印度建设五千兆瓦的核能发电能力。【原文：Billionaire Anil Agarwal-controlled Vedanta Group is seeking bids from global firms for building five gigawatts of nuclear power capacity in India, which the mining conglomerate plans to use for meeting energy needs at its facilities.】

item.title: 欧洲央行希望建立基于区块链的支付系统
item.description: 欧洲中央银行希望建立一个基于区块链的支付系统，允许金融机构以央行货币结算交易，这可能是向推出批发性央行数字货币（或称 CBDC）迈出的一步。【原文：The European Central Bank wants to establish a blockchain-based payment system that allows financial institutions to settle transactions in central-bank money, a potential step toward introducing a wholesale central bank digital currency, or CBDC.】

item.title: 保罗-艾伦的家族办公室分拆促进微软股票销售
item.description: 2021 年底，Cercano 管理公司从微软公司联合创始人保罗-艾伦（Paul Allen）的家族办公室分拆出来，此后一年，其美股投资组合中美国软件巨头的权重达到 17%。【原文：The year after Cercano Management was spun out of Microsoft Corp. co-founder Paul Allen’s family office in late 2021, its US stocks portfolio had a 17% weighting to the US software giant.】

item.title: 前往俄罗斯的油轮遭神秘爆炸袭击
item.description: 今年到目前为止，至少有四艘油轮发生爆炸；所有这些油轮在爆炸发生前几周都曾到过俄罗斯领海。【原文：At least four oil tankers have been hit with explosions so far this year — all of them having visited Russia’s territorial waters in the weeks prior to the blasts happening.】

item.title: 2025 年开局不顺，欧洲 IPO 呈现积极迹象
item.description: 欧洲首次公开募股市场今年的开局并不顺利，但顾问们表示，这些交易为下一批上市提供了积极的信号。【原文：Europe’s market for initial public offerings has gotten off to an uneven start this year, but advisers say the deals offer positive signs for the next batch of listings.】

item.title: 沙特汽车租赁公司考虑在沙特旅游业蓬勃发展之际上市
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的两家汽车租赁公司正在考虑在利雅得出售新的股份，以利用沙特吸引更多游客的势头。【原文：Two Saudi Arabia-based car rental firms are considering new share sales in Riyadh, seeking to capitalize on the kingdom’s drive to attract more tourists.】

item.title: 由 21 岁泰尔研究员领导的人工智能初创公司估值 20 亿美元
item.description: 由人工智能驱动的招聘初创公司Mercor在新一轮融资中获得了20亿美元的估值，这对这个位于旧金山的小型团队来说是一个巨大的突破，也是人工智能持续繁荣的最新迹象。【原文：Artificial intelligence-powered hiring startup Mercor has notched a valuation of $2 billion in a new funding round — a massive markup for the small San Francisco-based team and the latest sign of continuing AI exuberance.】

item.title: 赛勒战略公司出售可转换债券融资 20 亿美元
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的Strategy公司通过发行可转换债券筹集了20亿美元，此前这家比特币财务公司为投资者提供了优惠条件。该公司计划将所得资金用于收购更多数字代币等用途。【原文：Michael Saylor’s Strategy raised $2 billion from an issue of convertible debt after the Bitcoin treasury firm sweetened the terms for investors. It plans to use the proceeds for purposes including acquiring more of the digital token.】

item.title: 美国申请失业救济人数小幅上升，与科维德事件前水平持平
item.description: 上周美国失业救济金申请量变化不大，徘徊在科维德事件前的水平，这表明对工人的需求稳固。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits were little changed last week, hovering around pre-Covid levels that indicate solid demand for workers.】

item.title: 贝森特称美国可能会为乌克兰协议调整对俄罗斯的制裁
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，在有关乌克兰战争的谈判中，可能会对俄罗斯实施制裁减免，并称美国已准备好根据俄罗斯的谈判意愿加大或减少惩罚力度。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent signaled that sanctions relief for Russia could be on the table in talks over the Ukraine war, saying the US is prepared to either ramp up or take down penalties based on Russia’s willingness to negotiate.】

item.title: 范围》称，西班牙和德国受 3% 国防目标的影响最大
item.description: 根据 Scope Ratings 的数据，如果北约将国防开支目标提高一个百分点，西班牙、德国和比利时将面临欧盟国家中最大的公共财政打击。【原文：Spain, Germany and Belgium would face the biggest public-finance hit among European Union countries if NATO raised its defense spending target by a percentage point, according to Scope Ratings.】

item.title: 南非领导人敦促二十国集团团结一致应对全球挑战
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）敦促20国集团搁置分歧，集中精力应对世界上最紧迫的挑战。【原文：South African President Cyril Ramaphosa urged the Group of 20 nations to set aside their differences and focus on tackling the world’s most pressing challenges.】

item.title: 前枪贩经理因行贿赢得非洲石油交易而被定罪
item.description: 贡渥集团（Gunvor Group）的一名前经理被瑞士法院判定犯有贿赂公职人员以获得非洲石油合同的罪行。【原文：A former manager at Gunvor Group was found guilty by a Swiss court of bribing public officials to secure oil contracts in Africa.】

item.title: 特朗普向俄罗斯示好使卢布成为今年的明星产品
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普执政初期，美国对弗拉基米尔-普京的政策发生了巨大转变，俄罗斯货币对美元汇率因此上涨。【原文：Russia’s currency has gained against the dollar amid a dramatic shift in US policy toward Vladimir Putin in the early days of Donald Trump’s administration.】

item.title: 尼日利亚在通胀改革后暂停加息
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行暂停了急剧的货币紧缩政策，因为对用于计算通货膨胀的数据进行的全面检查显示，通货膨胀已明显放缓。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank paused its steep campaign of monetary tightening, after an overhaul of the data used to calculate inflation showed it had significantly slowed.】

item.title: 随着人工智能需求的增长，Together AI 初创公司估值达 33 亿美元
item.description: 为用户提供人工智能计算服务的初创公司 Together AI 在 General Catalyst 领投的交易中从投资者手中筹集了 3.05 亿美元，使公司估值达到 33 亿美元；这是企业对人工智能需求依然强劲的一个信号。【原文：Startup Together AI, which provides users access to artificial intelligence computing, has raised $305 million from investors in deal led by General Catalyst, bringing the valuation of the company to $3.3 billion — a signal that corporate demand for AI is still strong.】

item.title: 欧洲央行马克鲁夫警告通货紧缩进程面临危险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员加布里埃尔-马克鲁夫（Gabriel Makhlouf）警告说，在严重的不确定性下，消费者价格增长放缓将带来危险。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf warned of dangers to the slowdown in consumer-price growth amid acute uncertainty.】

item.title: Makhlouf 警告说，地缘政治风险将影响爱尔兰经济
item.description: 爱尔兰央行行长警告说，由于过度暴露于不断升级的全球贸易紧张局势，爱尔兰经济前景的下行风险已经增加。【原文：Downside risks to Ireland’s economic outlook have increased as its over-exposure to escalating global trade tensions remains high, the central bank governor warned.】

item.title: 贝森特将在周五电话会议中要求中国重新平衡经济
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）计划周五在北京与中国财政部长通话时敦促中国重新平衡经济。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent plans to urge China to rebalance its economy when he speaks to his counterpart in Beijing on Friday.】

item.title: 对冲基金人才争夺战激战正酣，千禧年以 1 亿美元出价吸引团队加入
item.description: 在对冲基金巨头之间爆发的挖角投资组合经理 Chris Procaccini（48 岁）的战争中，行业传奇人物伊兹-英格兰德（Izzy Englander）出面取得了胜利。【原文：As the war to poach portfolio manager Chris Procaccini, 48, erupted among hedge fund giants, industry legend Izzy Englander intervened to secure a victory.】

item.title: 特朗普改弦易辙后，页岩气重振交易议程
item.description:
随着新政府改变美国对化石燃料的政策，钻探商们正在加紧整合。【原文：

Drillers are ramping up consolidation as the new administration changes US policy toward fossil fuels.

】

item.title: 贝森特称终止美国债务发行 "遥遥无期
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，考虑到目前的障碍，包括美联储的量化紧缩计划，任何提高长期国债在政府债务发行中所占比例的举措都还遥遥无期。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that any move to boost the share of longer-term Treasuries in government debt issuance is some ways off, given current hurdles that include the Federal Reserve’s quantitative tightening program.】

item.title: TikTok重返美国应用商店，数周的不确定性带来了缓冲
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，亚历山德拉-莱文（Alexandra Levine）将探讨 TikTok 在美国的前景如何受到质疑。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Alexandra Levine looks at how TikTok has been hurt by the questions surrounding its future in the US.】

item.title: 菲尔博士》在流媒体时代的品牌重塑举步维艰
item.description:
Merit TV 进入了一个拥挤的新闻网络领域。它能找到自己的受众吗？【原文：

Merit TV has entered a crowded field of news networks. Can it find its audience?

】

item.title: 如果关税威胁成为现实，美国消费者将面临 "贴纸冲击
item.description: 在一次例行新闻发布会上，洛杉矶港又迎来了一个稳定的货运量月，加州零售商协会负责人借此机会就过度监管和提高进口税对家庭预算的威胁发出警告。【原文：A routine press conference to tout another solid month of cargo volumes at the Port of Los Angeles turned into an opportunity for the head of the California Retailers Association to warn about overregulation and the threat of higher import taxes on household budgets.】

item.title: 在特朗普的压力下，欧洲正在寻求贸易协议
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注的是欧洲对贸易协议的希望，而不是贸易斗争。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at European hopes for trade deals rather than trade fights. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 退伍军人推动 SPAC IPO 反弹，寻求交易的热情高涨
item.description: 华尔街正准备迎接另一波由经验丰富的保荐人和首次保荐人发起的空头支票公司浪潮，这显示了这些公司上市工具的持久力，也让人们对更多的交易充满期待。【原文：Wall Street is gearing up for another wave of blank check companies from seasoned and first-time sponsors, showing the staying power of the vehicles to take companies public — and setting up expectations of more deals.】

item.title: 阿布扎比阿德诺克公司寻求 28 亿美元出售天然气部门股权
item.description: 阿布扎比国家能源公司正寻求从其天然气业务的二次发行中筹集多达 104 亿迪拉姆（28.4 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s state energy company is seeking to raise as much as 10.4 billion dirhams ($2.84 billion) from a secondary offering in its gas business.】
